reviews.title: Hotel Not Recommended...
reviews.text: This hotel on the outside appearance seems really nice, and along with its decent price and close proximity to the World Trade Center does really well. But it does need to update it's decor inside, along with updating the rooms so that you don't hear the person in the next room sneezing or their intimate activities. The phone in the room had a lot of static making it very difficult for people to contact me in my room instead of on my cell phone. There was no voice mail system, so callers had to either call my cell phone for voicemail or trust the front desk to slip a note under my door. The television never worked, even after calling maintenance. And the controls for the air conditioner worked only after spending a half hour pressing the buttons really hard in order to get them to work. However, the hotel staff was more than outstanding. If anything, that is what made the stay bearable. But there is no bar, no gift ship, or mini bar. I do not recommend this hotel for business travel.

Tried to stay a couple of nights at El Diplomatico, as it is close to the National University, but it turned out to be a waste of time and money! I called them to make a reservation, and they ensured me they had available rooms for the next day, and I could walk directly to the front desk. What a mistake I made trusting the info they gave me over the phone! When I arrived to the front desk coming directly from the bus terminal with all my luggage, they simply told me they had no rooms, and didn't even offer an apology for giving me misleading information the day before!!! No one seemed to care about the situation, nobody offered any help. I had to call Hotel Sevilla (where I regularly stay but it is a little far away from the University Campus) to make a last minute reservation, and pay a taxi from El Diplomatico to Hotel Sevilla... In 4 years visiting Mexico City regularly, this is the first time I got such a poor service from a Mexican hotel!!! Needless to say, I will never try El Diplomatico again.
reviews.title: A waste of time and money
good hotel in mexico
reviews.text: Great food, good service and well located.

reviews.title: Good central location
reviews.text: Hotel is very clean and the people are friendly.
This hotel is very well situated. We never had to wait more than 30 seconds for a bus or taxi, and were at our destination in good time.
reviews.title: Fine. Just fine.

reviews.text: I stayed here in connection with a meeting so I didn't have much choice. It's pretty cheap but you get what you pay for. My room smelled funny and had a really loud AC unit. Also the room faced the main drag on the 4th floor and was really loud. I'd definitely advise if you stay here to try and get something that doesn't face Insurgentes if you can. As another reviewer mentioned there's a loud -- really loud restaurant across the street that stays open late.
reviews.title: Not Horrible but not great either

reviews.text: But, generally the hotel was pretty clean and again, fairly cheap. Still, I think you can find much better in Mexico City. Look a little harder!
reviews.title: Absolutely the worst

likes.disliked: — everything after check in and before leaving.

reviews.text: Got in late in the evening and was met by a staff that spoke zero english. In a big international city like Mexico City I would have expected better.
reviews.title: Good, comfortable, friendly staff, but...

reviews.text: Rooms looked passable enough so we settled in and ordered room service. It was awful...undercooked fish and shrimp so tough even my easy going husband got frustrated and gave up on it.
reviews.title: great room for a great price
